instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was working perfectly til i dropped a screw inside
threads.message:
FML this one i screwed up, lucky it was mine. i was taking diode measurements because it was a known working machine. dammit! dropped a small screw on the board and i heared a little electrical fart. pft it went but i cannot see what i messed up. here is some basic info. this was a perfect working board till i fucked it.

board is taking 5.17v @ 0.020A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.075v PPDCIN is 5.17v i changed the ISL and no improvment. if you could help me on where to start that would be great. i was actually troubleshooting another board when this happened. im such an IDIOT!

PPBUS g3H has a 0.373V drop to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was working perfectly til i dropped a screw inside
threads.message:
I sure feel for you.
I am a little green on this model.  Have one in the drawer and have only worked on a few of these so far.

Seems to me your <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is either shorted or the fuse is gone or both.

What is resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Did you check F7000

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was working perfectly til i dropped a screw inside
threads.message:
"PPBUS g3H has a 0.373V drop to ground."
Is that diode mode reading?
In such case, no short there.
Specify what you do correctly...

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was working perfectly til i dropped a screw inside
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was working perfectly til i dropped a screw inside
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was working perfectly til i dropped a screw inside
threads.message:
3V42 is required as first voltage.
Post voltages for <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U6903</CHIP>.
